title: How to improve my reading skill - Quora

response.answer_text: Comprehensive reading requires lots of patience, attention, concentration, focus and vocabulary to undetstand. While reading, be sure that you are not hungry, thirsty or anything else, this means there are no unnecessary interruptions. Use lead pencil to underline the words you fail to understand and consult dictionary later to know the meanings of the same. But, never take the help of dictionary at the time of reading as it affects your study and decreases your comprehension power. Besides, give yourself a try to realize any article with guess power which will enrich your confidence level and fill yourself with positive attitude. Pressurise on each and every word separately, observe their positions, functions in the sentence. Last, but not the least, complete reading passages, never finish them. I believe you understand the difference between completing and finishing. Always try to aviod subvocalization which seems a common problem among readers for decades, here I am providing some of most popular techniques to decrease the effect of the same 1. Use Your Finger to Point Your Eyes While Reading Keep on emphasizing the importance of using your finger out and guide your eyes. It’s a central principle to all speed-reading techniques and it’s something that will help you minimize subvocalization. Using your hand to guide your eyes will also help you grab groups of words while reading, helping you avoid another common reading habit, fixation. 2. Distract Yourself To minimize subvocalization, try distracting yourself from saying words in your head. How should you distract yourself? There are a couple of ways to do it. One way is try to chew gum while you read. If you chew gum while reading it will distract you from saying the words in your head. You can also distract yourself from saying words by occupying that voice in your head with another voice. Try counting from one to three while you are reading the material (example: “one, two three” line-by-line). While you are doing this, try fixating your eyes somewhere at the beginning of the line, somewhere in the middle of the line, and somewhere at the end of the line. While you are looking in those three places you want to be counting “one, two, three.” By doing this you will also be fixating on three groups of words, rather than each and every single word. You can count “one, two, three” out loud (maybe whispering) or in your head. Either way, you’ll distract yourself from saying the actual words you are reading. With some practice, you’ll find it easier to avoid saying all the words in your head as you read. 3. Listen To Music While Reading This will not only help you minimize subvocalization, but listening to music may also help you concentrate better. However, keep in mind that not all types of music are going to help you concentrate. You want to avoid listening to music with lyrics or anything with a strong beat because it is going to throw off your concentration. You may also want to avoid listening to songs that remind you of other things (your high school sweetheart, a fight scene from a movie or anything else that might further distract you). Listen to something that is instrumental. Classical music usually works best. That will help you to improve your concentration and it will also help you to minimize your habit of subvocalization. 4. Force Yourself To Read Faster Than You Normally Would Let’s say you normally read 250 wpm. Try going a little faster (maybe 300 or 350 wpm). If you force yourself to go a little faster than you normally read, you’ll minimize the amount of words you say in your head. In addition to minimizing subvocalization, you’ll also improve your focus because you have to pay attention more when you read a little faster. Again, the more you practice pushing yourself faster, the faster you will get. Hope it will cope up with your problem,..........

There are three basic rules to improve reading skill. ReadReadAnd read more.There is no other trick. To improve your reading skill, read as much as possible.  Writing can also help you to enhance your reading skills. Reading and writing are mutual, and supplement to each other. More you read more your become good writer and vice versa.Good vocabulary also help you to become good reader. We often leave the reading in between and loose interested only because we are not good at vocab.Consistency. Read daily. Be in touch, if not 100 pages daily you can read but certainly few paragraphs, be regular.Re-read. Read the same article again and again, it help you to understand he collocation and word structure slightly better, that can make you good reader.Memorize. Try to remember what you have read recently and how it was articulated.Practice. After reading an article try to write same article in your own words. It helps you to retain word.Love/Date. I fell in love with a girl not because she was beautiful. Not because she was intelligent and wise. Not because she from the top art stream college. But only she used to write very well, and love to read. Her choice of words was amazing!

Read anything, starting with the topics or authors that you find easier to read and digest. Focus and concentration take time to build. Don’t be too hung up on reading books a certain way I.e start to finish. Feel free to skim, pausing on topics that interest you or reading randomly from between. Pick a format that is convenient for you. Do you want to read while using public transportation? Figure out if headphones could dim background sounds while you read on your Kindle or physical book. The hardest though is this : don’t read books for social approval and don’t feel compelled to read best sellers . Though these are generally good guidelines for choosing a book that’s already been vetted by thousands, it does rob an element of freedom and discovery when you read what everyone else is reading. Don’t stress about yearly or monthly goals. Also try reading at bedtime. Reading fiction before bed is said to switch your brain from problem solving mode to storytelling mode, which is quite relaxing and appropriate for sleep. You might start to enjoy reading for it’s joy.

Get two copies of the same book: a print version and an audio version. Note that some devices and programs have print /audio functions available together. Follow the text with your eyes while listening. Be prepared to pause anytime you find a word, phrase, or sentence that does not make sense. Some programs include letting the reader look up definitions. Do not be afraid to begin your work with items written for younger people, even beginning with First Reader material. Create success for yourself and build on that success. Success will make the process enjoyable and you will make good progress. Finally, pause sometimes to write a sentence or more to summarize what you have read. This writing exercise will let you complete the reading / learning cycle.

When I picked up the set of “The Complete Sherlock Holmes “ and started with the first novel, I immediately realized that I had very poor Vocabulary. So to get the best of Sherlock, I decided to pick a notebook and a dictionary, and whenever new word arose , I looked up its meaning and wrote down the word , meaning and a sample sentence in the notebook. I would get about 5–10 new words in a page. And, after having completed a page, I would re-read the page to get the complete joy of reading where I could understand the author and flow of the words completely. Slowly , my grip on the understanding of Language increased and my Vocabulary became vast. And, I could read the further short stories and novel fluently and joyously. By the End of Reading the complete set, I had become a fast reader, deep reader with a better vocabulary and was a reader influenced and touched by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. To this day, Sherlock Holmes and Harry Potter are the best series that I have read.

Reding isn't a skill it's just a habit. You can develop your reading speed and comprehension by simply reading more. Eventually you will develop something called as spatial reading, where you read chunks of text together, instead of single words and sentences. Read everyday about the topics of your interest. In some cases people don't enjoy reading or find it bothersome because they think it takes them away from productive work. In such a state the question comes down to usefulness. If you are one of such a reader then read about the topics in which you want to become an expert. Not merely technical but cultural in nature. You should understand the language of that world effortlessly. Conclusion You can start with newspapers, a few short books or a single huge book. Reading quality blogs online is also a good habit. You remain informed about the topics of your interest regularly.

It can be anything cricket,food, travelling, history,etc. And later you can read Amitav Ghosh and William Dalyrmple novels as personally I love their novels.

practice. if u watch movies u might know what genre u like. get a book start reading. and a unique way is rapping, in my experience rapping songs made me read relatively fast. if u don't like poems and such stuff, and ur looking to read fast as in understnd words, you'll have to improve ur vocabulary the number of words you know. if ur talking abt interpretation than the actual speed of reading, and unless u wanna scan the whole dictionary, i suggest reading again, try and take up authors other than chetan bhagat cuz his writing is too simple but its good for starters. there is no other way but of course u can look at something and try to explain its position . for example , u see a boy trying to makes a sand castle on the beach try and discribe how it looks. if u feel like ur at a loss for words look it up in google. dont stop until u can explain queer different situations without any problems, that way you can learn more about the statements , even if u dont really know the meaning. when in practise analyse the question and read it again until u realise which word you dont under stand. then look up the word and fit the meaning with the statement. these are the things which helped me. hope it helps u too.

The simple way to improve your reading skills is the more you read, the more you get. Below are a few things you should keep in your mind:- • Read some good Novels and magazines • Improve your communication skills • Read business newspaper (FINANCIAL EXPRESS, BUSINESS TODAY, ECONOMIC TIMES, BUSINESS STANDARD) • Read a newspaper (TOI, INDIAN EXPRESS, THE HINDU) • Learn the basic grammar (Wren and Martin is the best books) • Improve your vocabulary (word power made easy • Add new words to your dictionary (at least 25 new words daily) • Watch English channels • Follow good YouTube channels • Think in English and try to talk in English on your own. Create a hypothetical situation in your mind and talk to yourself on particular topic. For more information you can visit our website:-  http://eliteoverseaseducation.com

This question is like asking,”How can reading improve your comprehension of knowledge?” “Unh…like you can acquire whole libraries of knowledge you couldn’t access before?” Only a very vanishingly small part of all music makes it onto the radio to be heard, or even has ever been recorded as sound at all. Even my local library has rooms full of shelves floor to ceiling marching across the rooms, with nothing but written music waiting to be explored by those who can sight-read the music.

One last thing try to read for 1 hour daily. Invest in yourself.

I don’t know that sight-reading necessarily improves your other music skills, but in and of itself it is a great skill to have depending on what musical situations you find yourself in. If you accompany singers or instrumentalists you are generally expected to be able to sight read the accompanist parts, and you will be more in demand if you can transpose them on sight also. In a band/ jazz band/ church/ orchestra/ musical/ wedding or casual gig if there is a “book” and you can NOT accurately sight read it you will NOT get called back for more gigs. This may include lead sheets, lyric sheets with chords, piano arrangements (that you have to decipher and adapt) or actual written out parts. Any of these may be in the wrong key and require transposition.
